intro: Descurainia longepedicellata, commonly known as the long-pedicellate stinkweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many mustard plants. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and linear, hairy leaves. It typically grows in dry, disturbed soils and is often found in prairies and along roadsides. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some regions.
